discussion.content:
C. User training
User training is the most effective way to address this issue. By educating users about the risks of writing down passwords and the importance of strong, unique passwords, you can encourage them to adopt safer practices.

While password managers can help to secure passwords, they are not a complete solution. User awareness and training are essential to prevent the misuse of passwords.

Selected Answer: C
User training

questions.question_text: A user reports that an Android mobile device takes a long time to boot, and all applications crash when launched. The user installed the applications from a third-party website. Which of the following steps should the technician complete to diagnose the issue?

choices.D: Confirm the compatibility of the applications with the OS.
choices.C: Enroll the device in an MDM system.

discussion.content:
A. Scan the system for malware.

Given that the user installed applications from a third-party website, there is a possibility that malware or malicious software has infected the device. Scanning the system for malware is a crucial step to diagnose and potentially resolve the issue.
